intro: Schnella bicomata, commonly known as the two-lobed snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland environments and has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers bloom in the spring and are usually yellow or white, attracting various pollinators. Schnella bicomata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
